alert.note: Alert for Northern Bristol; Western Norfolk (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 04 at 3:09AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Massachusetts, including the following areas, Northern Bristol MA and Western Norfolk MA. Portions of northern Rhode Island, including the following area, Southeast Providence RI. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Scattered to numerous showers and thunderstorms will re- develop this afternoon. Any thunderstorms have the potential to produce rainfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour which will elevate the risk of urban and street flooding along with localized flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
